description: From Middle French tranquiliser. Analyzable as tranquil +â€Ž -ize

verbs.description: tranquilize (third-person singular simple present tranquilizes, present participle tranquilizing, simple past and past participle tranquilized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To calm (a person or animal) or put them to sleep using a tranquilizer dart.
examples: The escaped lion was finally tracked down, tranquilized, and safely returned to the zoo.

entries.meaning: (transitive, now literary) To make (something or someone) tranquil.
